title: Substance Abuse Prevention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Davenport, IA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: They asked great questions and were very positive and honest about the position. They seemed like they really wanted to get to know me. Everything went smoothly and efficient. Great interview!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here ?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a recruiter for a phone screening and then was moved along in the process. I was interviewed by the hiring manager then a panel of potential peers. It was overall a straightforward process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to have a difficult conversation

title: Applications Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward process Took a month or two from application submission to first contact with Human Resources to interview with Hiring Manager to job offer. Allowed 4 weeks before starting new position
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for this company?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Had a telephone interview to discuss details of job as well as provide information from previous positions. From there moves to a hiring manager. Questions were fairly basic per typical interview process. Discussed strengths, weaknesses, what you like best about current job, what you would change. Nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite thing about your current job?

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Brooklyn, NY) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was good. They answered any and all questions I had and explained all positions applied for in detail about pay and hours. Phone interview was super easy as well.
Interview Questions: Ask about the Values of Unity Point

title: RN Clinical Informaticist Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Only had the phone screening with HR. Easy questions and she was very nice. It took over 3 weeks to hear back, and only because I emailed them regarding it. I got a prewritten rejection email template. I responded looking for feedback since I had the qualifications on the job listing but haven't heard back.
Interview Questions: Don't remember it was almost a month ago.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions:
Rather straight forward two part process. Team seemed unprepared with questions and really unconcerned with my time. Overall I felt it went as good as it could've. 

Hiring manager quietly declined me without any notification after I sent follow up communication. 

It doesn't bother me I didn't get selected, but it's extremely unprofessional to not send a follow up email or phone call to the interviewee explaining or giving your decision. That is very disrespectful to someone's time.
Interview Questions: Improving speed of SQL processes

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick response from Hr team, quick to interview and will get back to you with offer if they like you.  Have physical and screen, the go on to next steps
Interview Questions: Behavior questions, relation to role model

title: Vice President Talent & Culture Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter emailed me and set up an interview, then cancelled the interview 30 minutes prior via text. She then sent me an email and asked to reschedule the interview. She then was late and called me 20 minutes after our  interview was supposed to start with a ridiculous excuse. This was for an exec-level role and she seriously showed me no respect or consideration for my time…hence I was no longer interested in the opportunity. If this is how HR behaves and an Executive Recruiter who is the first contact with the company…I can just imagine how awful and unprofessional the culture is here. Hard no for me!
Interview Questions: Can we set up a time to connect.

title: ARNP Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Comfortable and welcoming environment. Various members of department present at round table discussion. All members had opportunity to ask questions of interviewer.  Interviewer was also encouraged to ask questions of panel in regards to the role being interviewed for to create open dialogue and expectations within the role applied for.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time you had to deal with a difficult situation with complex family dynamics, and how did you approach that situation?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Super great talking to the employees and lots of information was received. I loved the environment of the company and the ability for teamwork between coworkers that was established. The interviewers asked great questions and also answered all of mine
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Patient Companion Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: You apply.  They email you next day, call next week if they are interested. Interview with three people, the sitter manager, 3N manager and ICU manager. If you have the job they will call you next day and set up your drug screen and physical with occupational med
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral based questions.  Focus a lot on our values. Interview in the SAR format (Situation, Action, and Result).  Had an interview with the leader and a peer. Went smoothly and very easy to talk to.  Office looks like it had been newly remodeled
Interview Questions: How have you Fostered Unity in your line of work?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: First was a typical HR screening interview, then very soon after a hiring manager interview. The next step was a writing assignment, followed by panel interviews, both peer and leader. After committing to follow up personally, they sent an automated rejection email, which was shockingly unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when a project you worked on fell flat or wasn’t well-received.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Received invite for Phone interview , was supposed to be in person but was via phone because of COVID-19. Asked personal and behavioral questions, as well as a few about travel, etc .  Very quick and friendly interview.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to travel?

title: EAP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Waterloo, IA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: It went well, friendly staff person and easy conversation which explained a lot about the current health system and the need for mental health services for employers and employees within the local area.
Interview Questions: What made me interested in job posting?

title: Rehab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute sit down interview followed by a 1 hour job shadowing with a current rehab technician. The process was easy and the shadowing process allowed me to see the in and outs of the job.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in this job?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: It was very comfortable and they make you feel right at home from the start. It was so laid back, easy going and stress free unlike other interviews can be.
Interview Questions: What are my main values?

title: Behavioral Health Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Emphasis on experience, boundaries and how you manage multiple things at once. Organization is key. Must be a team player as well as adaptable and able to think quickly due to last minute changes
Interview Questions: How do I set boundaries?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with management and was very pleasant! Going into it I was not sure what to expect but they asked questions about my character and situational questions.  They also discussed how my experiences can contribute to the job.
Interview Questions: How will your prior experiences help you on this job?

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Preparing meals for patients in hospital in main kitchen. Two interviews are needed plus refs. Interview are professional, And respectful.  First interview is over the phone. The second one is in person at the site you will be working at.
Interview Questions: How much experience did I have.

title: Residential Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I met with the registered nurse and a team lead. It was very relaxed. They went over my previous work history, and they asked me questions about how I would handle certain situations.
Interview Questions: What types of disabilities have you worked with in the past?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Madison, WI)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a phone call 1 week later to set up a zoom interview. The interview lasted about an hour. It seemed as though the interview went okay but I wasn't really sure.  I received an offer the following week.
Interview Questions: What is your strength and why would it add value to our team?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, over the phone initial interview. Very friendly interviewer.  Human resources was aware of a very good general idea of what the position entailed. Quick and easy scheduling process.
Interview Questions: Why are you wanting a job here?

title: Clinical Patient Representative/Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy phone interview followed up with lengthy face to face interview.  After both phone and face to face wanted to do job shadow.  They were also very rigid on making me follow up with my references to fill out their email reference request.
Interview Questions: How are you a leader?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Peoria, IL) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was super nice and bubbly. She also told me about other positions that were open, allowing me to choose among several. She was very easy going and didn’t ask me anything that made me uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our company.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Focused on FOCUS values of the organization. On the nursing floor you had peer interviews in a more relaxed setting with potential co workers interviewing you. Very welcoming to the job, and allows you to ask questions.
Interview Questions: What is an example of fostering unity?

title: Legal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Sent in my resume and got a phone interview maybe a week after submitting my resume. I am still waiting on in person interview 2 weeks after the phone interview.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to rely on someone else for your success.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview.  Pretty generic questions.  I never heard positive or negative about the position.  It would be nice if they told you if you qualified or not.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving current position?

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Very good, when I interviewed.  Very nice people, very good people.  But i was an ideal candidate so the interview was a formality they were thrilled to have me.  Nonetheless very good people.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for a registered nurse position with UnityPoint is not difficult but it is a very long process.  They have the standard interview questionnaire and then you will be asked to complete simulation stations.  These do not test your “skills” but the way you problem solve and interact with patients and family members.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions about experience but they also had simulation stations set up.

title: Linen Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: From the interview to the starting point it can take about two weeks. First get phone call then in person interview and got a call back same day to tell me I got the job if background check and drug screen went well.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: HR called within one week of applying, had a phone conversation. She was very pleasant, asked how I would embody each of the mission statements. She asked a lot about how I would fit into UnityPoint.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had an issue with a policy

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward, will ask you about the company and why you want to work at UnityPoint Health, why you are seeking a job, for marketing health care experience is a plus but not a necessity.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UnityPoint Health?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was misleading and did not provide accurate insight into the job that I ultimately work. The manager made it sound like there were great benefits and that the team worked well together.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself 
Why do you want to work here
Tell me about your relevant experience

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Discussed skill set and previous employment to determine if there was a good match between work to be done and work previously done.  Wide range of people on the interview panel to get a larger perspective of potential candidate.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with these specific applications previously?

title: Counselor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with the supervisor and office manager. They asked fairly simple questions. It was pretty relaxed and easy going.  They did not ask me any difficult questions. There was no peer interview which I have had to do for other jobs within UnityPoint Health. They are planning to add peer interviews in this department going forward.
Interview Questions: What brought me to this job?

title: Clinic Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Recieved several calls, first was screening  as the first interview followed by face to face interview.  Friendly and fairly fast interview process.  An overview of the position also provided on first call as well.
Interview Questions: Why I applied for the position?

title: Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview turned out to be very informal, I was not asked any personality or ability related questions (which are normally expected in this type of interview). It was not very structured. Seems like they interview a lot of candidates and are tired of the process.
Interview Questions: Not many questions, however, main question was "why medicine?"

title: R N Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: 4+weeks and 3 different in person interviews after the initial phone screen. Meeting with eight plus employees. Took a very long time and was quite tedious having to make time to accommodate the process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Peoria, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well. Went over job duties and responsibilities . Went over resume & qualifications and training. Also went with staff. It was lunch time so I didn’t get to see patients or rooming
Interview Questions: What made you apply here?

title: Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Online application, followed by a phone interview, then an in-person interview. Lastly, there was an interview with the HR department after a job offer was made.  Friendly staff and information Human Resources team. They welcomed questions and were flexible with scheduling the interview.
Interview Questions: Questions built around previous experience

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job and was called within a few hours of applying to come in for an interview. At the interview I met two of the managers and they both asked a few questions and wrote down what I answered.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Keokuk, IA)
Interview Descriptions: I wasn't asked any questions about my qualifications or work experience. Not one question about my resume at all even though it was right in front of this person the whole time. Didn't reference it at all. I was kind of confused and just went with it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Learning Management Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
They required me to fill out an online profile, including references. I was also asked to complete a ridiculously long survey, that contained many questions only relevant to a nurse or other healthcare employee.

They asked me to set a time for a preliminary phone interview and immediately contacted my references. I thought it was inappropriate to contact my references before they even spoke to me.

They canceled my phone interview the next day, stating the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: First they offer you a phone interview. They will then offer you an in-person interview if you do well during the phone one. After the in-person interview they will call within one week to let you know whether or not they're interested in hiring.
Interview Questions: Who is most important to build a relationship with while in the workplace

title: Hardware Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy process, nothing more, even though glass door is requiring at least 30 words i'm just trying to fill space, why was this required?  How much longer until there are 30 words, seriously if you work in IT you will be fine.
Interview Questions: nothing serious

title: Customer Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied internally, talked to my boss and interviewed with a group panel. My boss was very supportive and even encouraged me to research the move within the division.  Boss said they wouldn’t be a good boss if they weren’t openly supportive of employees doing what fits them best.
Interview Questions: How do you think your current position will help you in this new position?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online application. Followed by email from recruiter. Set up call/ interview online. Recruiter phone call lasted about 20 minutes. Days later got a phone call from a manager about position was a 30 minute phone call which then led to face to face interview.
Interview Questions: Know there core values it is I'll help you know how you fit and your experience will benefit the organization with goals etc.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I didn't get any response after the second interview. I thought I did great. They should at least send a we're sorry this position is filled or sth to me.
Interview Questions: I don't remember...sorry

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Bettendorf, IA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Group interview where there were several interviews occurring for different positions at the same time. After that a recruiter took you out of the room and on a tour. Shortly after I was offered a position.
Interview Questions: What are your goals in healthcare?

title: Director, Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited from LinkedIn, interviewed with the recruiter, then interviewed with the VP. I never heard a response back. (This was 9 months ago...so I assume they moved on.) I requested feedback from the recruiter, and never received any.
Interview Questions: They asked about experience and examples of my work.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick, to the point. Many questions. It can seem a bit drilling and nerve wrecking at the beginning but, they do this to make sure good people will be taking care of their residents.
Interview Questions: It takes a certain type of person to be a CNA. What kind of person do you think that is?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was long. I was hired. I was supposed to start in August and did not start until November. I was continually told that i would start the next week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was an experience. I was contacted a few days after submitting my application for a phone interview. At the conclusion of the phone interview, the recruiter told me I was by far the top candidate and would be required to contact five references for screening. I connected with all five references and they completed the online process which included 28 rating questions and 2 essays. I then followed up with the recruiter a number of times over 2 and half months at which point an in person interview was scheduled. Last week I attended the in person interview and a week later was informed they are proceeding with another candidate. This process has taken a total of 12 weeks. In addition it has burned my references and wasted their time. I think it’s very unfair to require references from applicants when you’re not seriously considering them. The references I provided are important people and I hate that I wasted their time with this.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were based on the STAR behavioral-based situation response methodology. “Tell me about a time when…”

title: Emergency Department RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Peoria, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very professional. I applied online and was contacted for a personal interview. After the personal interview there was a drug screening and background check. After the results came in, I was called and given a verbal offer and emailed an offer.
Interview Questions: Why did I pick this hospital to apply?

title: Biller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Have to get through HR first before you can even truly interview. If you don't already work there, good luck trying to get in. They do a lot of promoting from within.  Which is great, if you already work there.  Bad if your trying to get your fit in the door.
Interview Questions: What would your former colleagues say about you?

title: Medical Biller Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Long. They took forever to tell me no when I applied out of my department. I was not allow Ed to job shadow my current boss would not let me away from her department to job shadow.theu would not take outside references.
Interview Questions: Why I want out of current job

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Peoria, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: none; i had no negotiating power: was informed "your just a nurse" when i questioned the pay for PA in comparison to NP was informed it did not matter because they are "the physician assistance" and have more the nurse practitioners to offer our physician
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty straight forward interview asking how you would respond to different situations and medical emergencies within surgery. It was pretty laid back overall though. Everyone was nice.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UnityPoint specifically?

title: Interventional Cardiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Peoria, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: after initial phone interview I Was invited  for in person interview with the group. Everyone was friendly and willing to help. After the interview I was offered a job after negotiation. I had to refuse it at the end for personal reason but I thought it was a good place to work.
Interview Questions: Credentials and training

title: EVS/PSA/MSA I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: I tried to get my old job back. I hat to move out off staid in 2009.take care off my sister she hat cancer after she passed on I came back into my Hause. I hat to go before my two weeks. She got worse so i had to go. It was a bick lie wehn thar said that I callt from Intiana.why wood I do that? ???? No Interview. Lina Carnes.
Interview Questions: No Interview.

title: Department Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were several hoops to jump through. In addition to the online application, there was an interview with the direct supervisors, a requirement of 5 referrals (that you had to make sure filled out the survey), and a work shadow with the team. The supervisor gave me a baseline salary for the position and I thought it had more wiggle room than it did. The have an equity system and the most they could offer someone in my position with my years of experience was only about 2/3 of what I make now. The wiggle room amounted to about 75 cents. Pretty bummed because the job itself seemed great.
Interview Questions: How well do you handle criticism?

title: Nurse Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process organized and the usual interview questions. Expect weeks and months before one receives a response back from the employer. May get an email response or one may have to check their website.
Interview Questions: What would your colleagues say about your work performance

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went to the job fair. It was a great way to meet people and get your foot in-the-door. I sent "Thank you" emails (I highly recommend this to anyone interviewing). I received responses the same day to sent up interviews. Remember always Dress To Impress!
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time you had poor communication. How would you fix this?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was about one and one-half hours. Everyone was friendly and professional. The organization and the culture they have is pretty impressive. I recommend arriving a little early, dress professionally, smile and be nice.
Interview Questions: Talk about a stressful experience and how you handled it.

title: Mental Health Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. It was about a month or so before I heard back from human resources. There was a normal phone screen. It was during the phone screen was when the in person interview was scheduled a week and a half later.
Interview Questions: average interview questions...what made you apply for this position, etc.

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sent in my resume and heard back the next morning, planned a phone interview a few days later. Took about 10 minutes on the phone as that was just going over the job a bit more and she asked me some basic questions and we scheduled an in person interview with HR. HR interview was situation based questions and again, going over the job some more. After that told me should would pass on my info to department manager and if she was interested would give me a call. Few days later got the call and scheduled another interview with manager. That interview she took me on a tour of the dept, told me about the people and work environment and again more situational based questions. Heard back within a week of that interview that I got the job. Overall, was quick enough process. Wasn't overwhelming and everyone I came across was nice.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation that you felt you could have handled better.

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with office manager and supervisor at Unity Point Health. Interview was very casual. It took less than 30 minutes. Manager asked me questions about dealing with patients and about my availability
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a patient who is being rude?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: VERY intense questions! Alot had totally nothing to do with getting the job! Was given a tour of the entire building, which some parts were seperate departments then I would have ever been going in.
Interview Questions: Experience with high tech computer programs

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The Manager mostly described the job duties of the position. It was fairly relaxed. I was not able to interview with a direct supervisor due to double booking.  It took 8 weeks after applying to get the interview scheduled and did not hear back either way.
Interview Questions: I was asked about strengths and weaknesses and the standard question of tell me about yourself. She asked why I wanted to leave my current position.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (West Des Moines, IA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process.  They ask behavioral questions and personality questions. They have you interview with the staff to ensure you're a good fit.  Positive experience. Background check took the longest since I lived out of state.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress on the job?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Sioux City, IA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fast and excellent. It took less than two weeks to apply and get an interview. Then about a week longer to receive an offer.Which all occurred over holidays. It was one of the fastest processes I have been through when applying for a job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Where do you see yourself in ___ years? Etc.

title: Senior LawSon Support Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
It was a One-on-one and Group/Panel Interview and HR Personal Interview. 
Interview was a very laidback Styte - asked Lawson System Developement and upgrade Experience
Which version of Lawson implementation - I did? What are the Various componenets of Lawson Implementation (Such as : HR/PAYROLL , GL, SUPPLY CHAIN,COST ACCOUNTING, FINANCIAL PACKAGES, such as :AP,A/R ETC.
Interview Questions: What Version of Lawson Inplementation - you worked on earlier? Let us know Pros and cons of Upgrade of various Lawson versions

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Fort Dodge, IA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process was easy and painless. They were very accommodating and professional with the interview. Simple interview questions were asked. Process took about 2-3 weeks. They do drug test and strength test.
Interview Questions: Weaknesses, Strengths, Why do you want to work here.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard interview process. Phone screening interview followed by a second in-person interview. Typical interview questions, though they have been introducing more behavior-based interview questions into the process
Interview Questions: Nothing really unexpected.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Peoria, IL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: My interview was a formality. I had been doing agency work there and they bought my contract. They had already decided to hire me, then sent me through the process with HR
Interview Questions: They were most interested in when I was going to get my BSN since I have an ADN

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health
Interview Descriptions: Was very throughout
Interview Questions: Hard thing you've done

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Interviewed at the facility in Cedar Rapids, IA the summer of 2013. From start to finish the process was about 5 weeks (I know it has been streamlined in 2016).
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict in the work place?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Moline, IL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is slow and long be willing to wait and meet a number of people phone interview eight HR, then will move on to meet with the hiring department
Interview Questions: What is one thing I want to accomplish in the next five years?

title: Store Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I Interviewed with the direct supervisor by phone within a week of applying online through the company's website. My Second interview was in person with a four person peer panel and with the hiring manager immediately following.
Interview Questions: All behavioral based interview questions. Tell me about a time when...

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: You apply online, and the application gets sent to the manager. I recieved a phone call a few days after applying, and come into the office for an interview soon after. A week later I was offered the job and accepted. Because I was already working at the hospital, I did not have to re-do the drug test. The orientation process was very thorough, and was able to follow a nurse on the floor for a few months. I felt very prepared.
Interview Questions: No questions were really very difficult.

title: ER Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (West Des Moines, IA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I fill out information online, submitted my resume, I was called for a phone interview and then a 1:1 interview followed by meeting with some of the nursing staff. I was offered the position the following day. I accepted the offer and meet with the Human Resources department later that week.
Interview Questions: How much experience I had in the ER field.

title: Dietetic Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Simple and to the point. 3 step process interview- phone, one on one, and panel. Situational questions. After the phone interview, the supervisor/manager will ask you to come in to a panel with up to 3 different people. Interviewers are laid back but please be professional and dress appropriately. 
Being part of this company is a great privilege, they were voted one of the best places to work in Iowa. It really is a great place to work; they love their employees, give great benefits, and lots of perks!
Interview Questions: Describe one time you made a mistake and how did you fix it?

title: Rehab Therapy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Cedar Rapids, IA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process went very smoothly. The interview with HR and therapy manager in same day.  I spent about thirty minutes with human resources and thirty minutes with the manager. Then the manager took me on a tour of the hospital.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (Des Moines, IA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews but this was several years ago. One by phone and one in person. Always be prepared for the interview process. It helps to have good references from colleagues who may be within the system already.
Interview Questions: Discuss the most difficult patient in your practice and how you handled the situation

title: Computer Programming Positions Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UnityPoint Health (West Des Moines, IA) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a manager from IT during a private job fair the company had at a local hotel.  The only information I could get about the available positions was just the job title.  There were no job descriptions or job qualifications provided and the IT manager was pushy about me applying for a position based on job title alone.  He acted annoyed when I started asking a few questions about job duties and qualifications.  I told him I would think about the positions and send a resume in if interested.
Interview Questions: Here is a list of jobs.  Which one do you want?  (No job descriptions were available)
